original: Edvall, Carl-Anker Olof, leg. läkare, Lidköping, f. 12/4/20 i StMm av maskinchef Adolf E. o. Lilly Nyberg. G. 44 m. Terry LundqviiSt. — Stud :ex. i Kalm. 39, med. kand. v. Karol. inst. 42, med. lic. där 46. Stud:vist. i Engl. 36. Div. förordn. s. prov:läk. m. m. i Norrfjärden, Vårgårda m. fl. 44-47, e. o. aman. v. patol. inst. v. Karol. sjukh. 45, und:läk. v. Lidköp. las. kir. avd. 46-47. Hobbies: ridning, fiske. Mil. idr:GM, mil. ’skytteM.
translated: Edvall, Carl-Anker Olof, registered physician, from Lidköping. Born on April 12th, 1920 in StMm to chief engineer Adolf E. and Lilly Nyberg. Married in 1944 to Terry Lundqvist. He passed his student exam in Kalmar in 1939 and earned his bachelor’s degree in medicine at the Karolinska Institute in 1942, and his medical license there in 1946. He studied in England in 1936. He has had various appointments as a provisional physician, among others in Norrfjärden and Vårgårda from 1944-1947, acting assistant at the pathology institute at Karolinska Hospital in 1945, and assistant physician at Lidköping Hospital's surgical department from 1946-1947. His hobbies are horseback riding and fishing. He has received a marksmanship award from the military.
